name: Bengali Bhuna Khichuri
description: A flavorful mix of rice and lentils cooked with aromatic spices.
recipe: 1. Wash rice and lentils together. Set aside.
2. Heat ghee in a pot, add chopped onions, and sauté until golden brown.
3. Add cumin, coriander, and turmeric powders. Sauté for a minute.
4. Add washed rice and lentils, mix well, and sauté for a few minutes.
5. Add water and salt. Bring to a boil and then simmer until rice and lentils are tender.
6. Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Dhaka Biryani
description: Spicy and aromatic biryani with marinated meat and fragrant rice.
recipe: 1. Marinate chicken with yogurt, cumin, coriander, garam masala, and salt. Refrigerate for an hour.
2. In a pot, boil rice until 70% cooked. Drain and set aside.
3. In a separate pan, cook marinated chicken until partially done.
4. In a biryani pot, layer partially cooked rice and partially cooked chicken.
5. Add ghee, fried onions, and finish cooking on low heat until rice and chicken are fully cooked.
6. Serve hot with raita. Enjoy!

name: Ilish Bhapa
description: Hilsa fish marinated with mustard paste and then steamed to perfection.
recipe: 1. Clean and wash the Hilsa fish pieces.
2. In a bowl, mix mustard paste, chopped green chilies, turmeric powder, and salt.
3. Marinate the fish pieces with the mustard mixture. Let it sit for 30 minutes.
4. Wrap the marinated fish pieces in banana leaves and secure with toothpicks.
5. Steam the wrapped fish for about 20-25 minutes.
6. Heat mustard oil and pour it over the steamed fish before serving. Enjoy!

name: Panta Bhat with Fried Hilsa
description: Fermented rice soaked in water served with fried hilsa fish.
recipe: 1. Soak fermented rice in water until it softens.
2. Clean and wash the Hilsa fish pieces. Sprinkle salt and turmeric on them.
3. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown.
4. Mix chopped green chilies with the soaked fermented rice.
5. Serve the fried Hilsa with the soaked rice. Enjoy!

name: Fuchka (Pani Puri)
description: Crispy puris filled with spicy tamarind water, potatoes, and chickpeas.
recipe: 1. Make a hole in the center of each puri shell.
2. Fill each puri with mashed potatoes and boiled chickpeas.
3. Pour tamarind water into each puri.
4. Sprinkle chaat masala on top and add mint chutney to taste.
5. Garnish with sev. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Rui Macher Jhol
description: Spicy Bengali-style Rohu fish curry with vegetables.
recipe: 1. Clean and wash the Rohu fish. Marinate with turmeric and salt.
2. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown. Set aside.
3. In the same oil, add cumin powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder.
4. Add chopped tomatoes and sauté until the oil separates.
5. Add potato wedges and sauté for a few minutes.
6. Add water, salt, and bring to a boil. Add the fried fish and simmer until potatoes are cooked.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice. Enjoy!

name: Begun Bhorta
description: Mashed spicy eggplant served with rice or flatbread.
recipe: 1. Roast the eggplants until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft.
2. Peel the skin and mash the eggplant flesh.
3. Add chopped green chilies, chopped onions, and salt.
4. Drizzle mustard oil on top and mix well.
5. Serve with rice or flatbread. Enjoy!

name: Chitol Macher Muitha
description: Fish ball curry made from chitol fish.
recipe: 1. Grind the soaked Bengal gram into a smooth paste.
2. In a bowl, mix minced Chitol fish, Bengal gram paste, ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
3. Shape the mixture into small balls (muitha).
4. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish balls until golden brown.
5. In the same oil, add cumin and coriander powder. Add water to make a curry.
6. Add the fried fish balls and simmer until cooked through.
7. Serve with steamed rice. Enjoy!

name: Shak Shobji
description: Mixed greens cooked with mustard paste and spices.
ingredients: 4 cups mixed greens (spinach, mustard greens, fenugreek)
recipe: 1. Clean and wash the mixed greens. Chop them finely.
2. In a pan, heat mustard oil and sauté chopped greens until wilted.
3. Add mustard paste, chopped green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
4. Cook until the greens are tender and the flavors are well blended.
5. Serve as a side dish with rice or flatbread. Enjoy!

name: Misti Doi
description: Sweetened yogurt, a popular dessert in Bangladesh.
recipe: 1. Boil the milk and let it cool to lukewarm temperature.
2. Add sugar to the lukewarm milk and stir until dissolved.
3. Add a few tablespoons of plain yogurt as a starter and mix well.
4. Pour the mixture into individual containers.
5. Cover and keep in a warm place for fermentation (about 8-10 hours or overnight).
6. Once set, refrigerate until chilled.
7. Serve cold and enjoy this sweet treat!

name: Bhapa Pitha
description: Steamed rice cakes filled with jaggery and grated coconut.
recipe: 1. Mix rice flour with water to make a smooth batter.
2. In a separate bowl, mix grated jaggery, grated coconut, and cardamom powder.
3. Grease the molds for steaming with oil.
4. Pour a layer of rice flour batter into each mold.
5. Add a spoonful of the jaggery and coconut mixture on top.
6. Cover with more rice flour batter, filling the molds.
7. Steam the filled molds for about 20-25 minutes.
8. Allow them to cool slightly before serving. Enjoy!
